page.title: 14OLDER RESIDENTS REMEMBER 2
page.content:
There were galas and the colourful Herring Fair on the cobbled High Street.
Traditional industries such as Farming and Fishing have declined to be replaced mainly by A.P.C.M. Cement in the 1960s, Torness Power Station which was started in the 1970s. Neither of the ladies was aware of trade unionism in the first part of the Century though Mr McMartin felt that they were well established by the 1940s. Both ladies commented on the lack of opportunities for women in business - Mrs Graham remembered the shock in the town when Bessie Moodie was appointed to work in a lawyer's office !
All of them commented on the changes in education, discipline and health. (continued on page 3)
